TermArray.name: stabilizing
TermArray.definition: Selection in which mean phenotype in population is more fit than extreme phenotypes

TermArray.name: disruptive
TermArray.definition: Selection in which mean phenotype in population is less fit than extreme phenotypes

TermArray.name: overdominance
TermArray.definition: Selection in which heterozygotes at a locus are more fit than both homozygotes

TermArray.name: underdominance
TermArray.definition: Selection in which heterozygotes at a locus are less fit than both homozygotes

TermArray.name: genetic drift
TermArray.definition: Random fluctuations in allele frequency resulting from small population size

TermArray.name: inbreeding
TermArray.definition: Producing offspring through matings with closely related individuals

TermArray.name: Wahlund effect
TermArray.definition: Observing fewer heterozygotes than predicted by Hardy-Weinberg because one is sampling across multiple populations
